title: Totally positive skew-symmetric matrices
authors: Jonathan Boretsky, Veronica Calvo Cortes and Yassine El Maazouz
abstract:
A matrix is totally positive if all of its minors are positive. This notion
of positivity coincides with the type A version of Lusztig's more general total
positivity in reductive real-split algebraic groups. Since skew-symmetric
matrices always have nonpositive entries, they are not totally positive in the
classical sense. The space of skew-symmetric matrices is an affine chart of the
orthogonal Grassmannian $\mathrm{OGr}(n,2n)$. Thus, we define a skew-symmetric
matrix to be totally positive if it lies in the totally positive orthogonal
Grassmannian. We provide a positivity criterion for these matrices in terms of
a fixed collection of minors, and show that their Pfaffians have a remarkable
sign pattern. The totally positive orthogonal Grassmannian is a CW cell complex
and is subdivided into Richardson cells. We introduce a method to determine
which cell a given point belongs to in terms of its associated matroid.
